title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: sheffield mp jared o'mara suspended from labour party .
bradford toddler window fall murder case adjourned .
fan arrested at leicester v leeds match over 'racial slur ' .
police release of leeds baseball bat attack victim .
belle vue stadium plan talks have stalled , council says .
bill of £ 180k to police north yorkshire fracking protest .
doncaster hotel receptionist praised for delivering baby in car park .

documents.title: that 's all from wednesday
text: those are all the updates from wednesday 25 october .
want to get all the latest news , sport , travel and weather on thursday 26 october 2017 ?
click here .

documents.title: thousands of heritage sites 'at risk '
text: thousands of heritage sites 'at risk '

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today .
we 'll be back tomorrow from 06:30 with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel for yorkshire .
updates on breaking news will continue right here throughout the night , but before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :
see you tomorrow

documents.title: watch : fly-tipper 's van crushed by council
text: a van used to fly-tip waste in rotherham has been crushed by the council .
the ford transit was flattened after its owner glynn atkinson , 53 , was caught on cctv using it to dump rubbish in country lanes , according to the council .
atkinson , of osberton street , rawmarsh , admitted three breaches of environmental law and was sentenced at sheffield magistrates ' court :

documents.title: talks 'stall ' on rugby stadium plan
text: talks 'stall ' on rugby stadium plan

documents.title: huddersfield town midfielder ruled out for 12 weeks
text: huddersfield town midfielder philip billing has been ruled out for up to 12 weeks after undergoing ankle surgery .
the 21-year-old suffered the injury in the terriers ' 2-0 defeat at swansea earlier this month .
the denmark under-21 international has scored once in nine appearances for the terriers this season .
`` the focus now is to help him return fitter and stronger than before , so he is ready to help us for the rest of the season , '' boss david wagner said .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pm reacts to jared o'mara comments
text: pm reacts to jared o'mara comments

documents.title: woman is only passenger on holiday jet
text: a woman who paid just £ 46 for a flight to crete has spoken of her amazement at being the only passenger on board the plane .
karon grieve , from dunlop in ayrshire , described her flight with leeds-based jet2 from glasgow to the greek island - which normally carries 189 passengers - as `` surreal '' .
she was given the vip treatment after two other passengers booked on the flight failed to turn up .
jet2 said it was `` not unusual '' for the final flight of the season to have fewer bookings than normal .

documents.title: man , 19 dies after collision in north yorkshire
text: a 19-year-old man 's died after being involved in a collision in north yorkshire earlier today .
emergency crews were called after a white mercedes box van and a blue audi quattro collided on the b1257 near stokesley at about 10:20 this morning .
the road remains closed and police are at the scene investigating what happened .
north yorkshire police are appealing for any witnesses to come forward .

documents.title: receptionist praised for delivering baby in car park
text: a hotel receptionist at a south yorkshire service station has been praised for her help and quick thinking in delivering a baby in a car park .
karen dyass , who works at the hotel at doncaster north service station , came to the aid of heather and matthew mcsharry when heather 's waters broke on their way to the hospital .
ms dyass was guided by medics over the phone and had to clear the baby 's airway as he was not breathing and mend his snapped umbilical cord with a shoelace .
the mcsharry family had stopped at the service station on 14 october as their two-year-old son needed the toilet .

documents.title: police release of leeds baseball bat attack victim
text: police in leeds have taken the unusual step of releasing of a man who was attacked with a baseball bat in an attempt to find the person who did it .
francis manda , 43 , had been to lupton stores in harehills when he was attacked by someone with a baseball bat between 16:00 and 16:15 on friday 29 september .
mr manda received a serious blow to his head and has not left hospital since the attack .
police say they do n't know exactly where the attack took place and despite investigating the assault , they have struggled to find out who did it .
officers say mr manda is `` very unwell '' and that they have released the in a bid to track the attacker down .
i would like to thank francis ' family for making the brave decision to release these images to the public , which i know may be distressing for some people . ''

documents.title: lorry-top fracking protester arrested
text: a protester who climbed onto a lorry bound for a north yorkshire fracking site has been arrested .

according to north yorkshire police , the man climbed down from the lorry which was heading for the kirby misperton site at about 14:10 and was arrested on sus of holding on to a motor vehicle in motion .
third energy has not received final consent to begin fracking at the site in ryedale , but expects to start before the end of the year .
fracking is the process of drilling down into the earth to release the gas inside .
opponents say it can cause water contamination and earthquakes .

documents.title: jurors 'offered £ 500 to fix verdicts '
text: jurors 'offered £ 500 to fix verdicts '

documents.title: have you seen this missing woman from elland ?
text: a 30-year-old woman has gone missing from elland in west yorkshire .
kerry gladwin was last seen on wednesday 18 october in sowerby bridge .
she was wearing a beige coat with a fur collar and is believed to have links to halifax town centre .

documents.title: new role for former northallerton prison site
text: the redevelopment of northallerton 's former prison has moved a step closer .
hambleton district council and hull-based regeneration company wykeland group have formed a joint venture for what 's described as the town 's most significant regeneration scheme for decades .
proposals for the disused site include retail units , a heritage centre , apartments , restaurants and an area for public events .
a planning application is due to submitted in the first quarter of 2018 .

documents.title: man seriously hurt after being knocked down in wakefield
text: a 79-year-old man has been left with a serious head injury after he was knocked down in wakefield yesterday evening .
he was crossing a road in horbury town centre at about 19:35 on tuesday when he was hit by a red suzuki alto which was going from cluntergate onto twitch hill .
the man was taken to hospital where he was treated for his head injury .
the driver of the car stopped and spoke to police at the scene .
officers say they want any witnesses to come forward .

documents.title: paralympian opens new £ 50,000 playground in sheffield
text: paralympian and strictly come dancing contestant jonnie peacock has been in sheffield to unveil a new playground .
the state-of-the-art playground at phillimore primary in darnall has had a makeover costing about £ 50,000 .
the primary school won the playground after pupils participated in a programme which encourages young people to take part in inclusive sport .

documents.title: breakingjewellery stolen in leeds city centre ram-raid
text: more details have been released after a 4x4 was used in a ram-raid at at jewellers in leeds city centre this morning .
it happened just before 11:30 when a red ford ranger 4x4 was driven in to the front of hymans jewellers on call lane .
a number of masked people then entered the shop and stole jewellery before leaving the premises and abandoning the 4x4 at the scene .
they jumped into a blue ford focus , which was also later found abandoned .
anyone with information about the ram-raid , or who witnessed what happened , is being asked to contact police :
we have already had a number of people come forward , including some people with footage of the incident . ''

documents.title: road reopens after 4x4 reverses into leeds jewellers
text: it looks as though the cordon has now been lifted at the site of the earlier incident in leeds , where a 4x4 reversed into a jewellers on call lane :
this was the scene earlier after police were called to the scene just after 11:30 this morning :
buses-4/5/11/15/16/19/19a/40/64/74/74a-police incident on call ln o/side corn exchange cleared.rd reopened.buses revert back to normal route

documents.title: watch : rotherham woman 's shock at £ 80 fine for feeding birds
text: an 83-year-old woman has spoken of her surprise at being fined £ 80 for feeding the birds in rotherham .
jean corker was accused of littering after putting fat balls and mealworms on the ground for the pigeons in the town centre last week .
rotherham council has since reviewed the fine and cancelled it , saying it did n't believe this was a suitable case for the issue of a fixed penalty notice :

documents.title: winter is coming : west yorkshire 's grit teams back in action
text: here 's a question : what do people who work on gritting teams get up to over the summer ?
answers on a postcard please .
have you missed us over the summer ?
we 're out filling grit bins and training our drivers - the season is about to start !
you actually going to use enough grit this year , seeing as last winter was so mild and you should have some saved ?
or is it the usual ?
have a great season

documents.title: missing 80-year-old woman 'safe and well '
text: we mentioned a little while ago the search for missing 80-year-old barbara clarkson , who 'd gone missing in leeds earlier today .
happily , police have now confirmed she 's been found `` safe and well '' .
officers wish to thank everyone who assisted in finding her , police say .

documents.title: northallerton police station closure 'to save £ 2m '
text: a north yorkshire police station is to be sold and its services moved elsewhere permanently , it 's been confirmed .
northallerton police station was closed on a trial basis last year , with most people being taken to harrogate or the force 's new hq .
north yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner julia mulligan says the move will save more than £ 2m in the next five years .

documents.title: women runners organise their own race after £ 1,000 sports scam
text: a group of women runners in sheffield have organised their own race after falling victim to an apparent online scam .
members of the sheffield strideout group paid £ 1,000 for 50 places in the she runs the night event at the city 's endcliffe park on friday .
however , sheffield city council said it had received no booking from the event 's organiser .
strideout club runner charlotte holmes said : `` to find out not only that we 'd we lost our money but then that opportunity to do that race had gone , i was bitterly disappointed . ''
the club has organised its own 5k race in the park on friday evening .

documents.title: eighty-year-old woman with dementia missing in leeds
text: an 80-year-old woman who suffers from dementia and who is unable to talk to people has gone missing in leeds .
barbara clarkson was last seen shortly before 12:15 today in queen street in morley , at the junction with fountain street .
she was wearing a brown coat , dark trousers , grey hat and black trainers with a white stripe .
police say she has advanced stage dementia and is unable to hold a conversation and that it is likely she is wandering around on foot .
anyone with information about her whereabouts is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: car thieves target vehicles in rotherham
text: there 's been a spike in the number of sat navs , laptops , mobile phones and other personal items being stolen from vehicles in the wath area of rotherham .
police say over the past few nights a number have been taken from vehicles
some appeared to have been left unsecured with valuable items on display .
the theives have targeted vehicles on boswell road , park road , chapel street , cemetary road , and other locations .
crime reduction officer , dene tinker , said : `` always lock your vehicle in a residential area or in the street .
never leave personal documents or sat navs in the vehicle . ''

documents.title: watch : campaign to stop attacks on firefighters
text: firefighters faced an increase in violence against them last year according to west yorkshire fire and rescue service .
they say that there have been a handful of attacks this year already including one in which a firefighter was hit in the stomach with a firework .
an 18-year-old has been arrested .
they 've released figures ahead of bonfire night : there were 95 attacks on crews last year , an increase of 50 % .
today a campaign aimed at stopping the attacks has been launched
it says all of their fire engines carry cameras and people attacking them will be prosecuted .
footage from previous years has been released :
if you have your sus that your children may be involved in such behaviour then please step in now before they end up in serious trouble with the police . ''

documents.title: leeds defender jansson extends deal
text: leeds defender jansson extends deal

documents.title: 4x4 reverses into leeds jewellers
text: a 4x4 has been reversed into a jewellers in leeds this lunchtime , details are still sketchy , but this is what we know so far :
west yorkshire police say they were called just before 11:30 to the scene at call lane .
they say `` officers are in attendance and enquiries are ongoing '' and there has been speculation from shop keepers nearby that two men may have run off from the scene .
the damaged shop is hyman jewellers which has been trading since 1975 .

documents.title: listen : prime minister responds to suspension of sheffield mp
text: the mp jared o'mara - who 's accused of making sexist and homophobic remarks - has been suspended from the labour party while an inquiry is held into his behaviour .
he 's apologised for comments made more than a decade ago , but denies more recent allegations .
during prime minister 's questions today , theresa may was asked about the matter :

documents.title: listen : fracking protest policing should be paid for 'from national funds ' - mp
text: the north yorkshire mp whose constituency covers a site in ryedale where fracking is expected to start shortly says the cost of policing anti-fracking protests there should be paid for by national funds .
his comments come after it was revealed the force spent almost £ 200,000 on staffing protests at the kirby misperton site in august and september .
that figure does n't include officers ' salaries .
north yorkshire 's police and crime commissioner julia mulligan says she will ask for government money if the force do n't have enough cash to fund policing protests at the fracking site in ryedale .
conservative mp kevin holinrake says policing should not be paid for by local taxpayers :
author: Nathan Turvey
BBC Radio York News

documents.title: fan arrested at leicester v leeds match over 'racial slur '
text: a man was arrested at last night 's carabao cup match between leicester city and leeds united following reports of a racial slur .
leicestershire police said officers arrested an 18-year-old male at the match on sus of racially aggravated public order .
the force could not confirm if he was a leicester or leeds fan , but added that he remains in police custody .
author: Calum McKenzie
BBC Local Live

documents.title: car hits leeds city centre jewellers
text: a 4x4 has been reversed into a jewellers in leeds , leaving a main bus route around the centre of the city closed .
west yorkshire police have yet to reveal details of what 's happened on call lane .

documents.title: doncaster mp welcomes jared o'mara investigation
text: don valley mp caroline flint has tweeted her response to the news that sheffield hallam mp jared o'mara has been suspended from the labour party .
i welcome @ twitterid investigation into allegations against jared o'mara mp and the decision to suspend him pending that enquiry .
@ twitterid only instigated this because of media , if people had n't expressed outrage they 'd have been happy to have this low life as an mp
christine i thought you were innocent until you are proved guilty and not the other way round .
your language is unacceptable
this is not a court of law , it 's an investigation by the @ twitterid who do n't have a good record on this eg @ twitterid report .
i imagine a young man growing up with cp might , occasionally be very angry with the world ( in no way condoning his actions btw . )
and this episode goes to show the deep complexity of modern life for many youths - coping mechanisms , achievement , social media etc .
i and many other people have had deep complexities to deal with and have done so without recourse to 'fudge packers ' 'sluts ' and 'fat bitch '
exactly !
people , their lives and the world they exist in are all very complex environment/conditions etc can create nasty effects .
'nasty effects ' also result of lacking personal responsibility , a decency compass and a nice old fashioned british thing called manners : - )
put your hand up if you 're being helped back into parliament .
much better than what they have
the man who enabled the tories to put thru lansley 's health & social care act , helped block a £ 100m loan to sheffield forge masters
historical allegations are one thing , recent ones another .
any @ twitterid mem facing allegations like this should be suspended/investigated .
you would you 're a woman
what is wrong with you ?
do you just have an issue with strong women or are you just a ty droll sexist
i have no problem with woman and equality only those who keep banging on about how bad they are treated and the world owes them a living
why has it taken you three days to come out with this ?
was the previous misogyny/racism/homophobia/creepiness ok ?
disgraceful , a woman makes an allegation and the man is tainted forever .
bordering on a witch hunt
problem is you know momentum will have unleashed the flying monkies to muddy the waters .
we also need a review on what checks are made on prospective parliamentary candidates so this does not occur again

documents.title: breakingroad in leeds closed after 4x4 reverses into jewellers
text: a road in leeds has been closed off after a jewellers was damaged when a 4x4 has reversed into it .
call lane near the market is currently cordoned off .
more to follow

documents.title: sheffield mp o'mara suspended from labour party
text: labour has confirmed that sheffield hallam mp jared o'mara has been supended .
the party will launch an investigation into his behaviour after he posted misogynistic and homophobic comments online more than a decade ago .
the sheffield hallam mp , who was elected this year , apologised for remarks made online in 2002 and 2004 , but denies the more recent allegations .
on monday mr o'mara resigned from the women and equalities committee after political website guido fawkes unearthed offensive comments made by the 35-year-old mp .
then on tuesday , sophie evans told the bbc 's daily politics she had met mr o'mara on a dating app and there had been `` no hard feelings '' when things did n't work out between them .
but in an incident in march 2017 mr o'mara , who was djing in a nightclub , made comments to her that `` are n't broadcastable '' , she said .
mr o'mara said this was `` categorically untrue '' .

documents.title: breakingjared o'mara suspended from labour party
text: jared o'mara suspended from labour party , says john mcdonnell .
more to follow .

documents.title: voice of bradford : and then there were three
text: the final three people who could become the bbc 's voice of bradford have been announced .
the process has seen the final three chosen from more than 100 people , with the goal of working for bbc yorkshire for a year .
let 's see who they are ( from left to right ) :
christy sherry
he says that his love for bradford `` is probably a bit unusual .
maybe even bordering on downright weird '' .
shama amin
shama is a full-time mum .
compared to looking after children , working at the bbc will seem like a doddle !
faisal motin
he impressed the judges at the auditions with his rap about bradford .
good luck to all three !
author: Voice of Bradford

documents.title: bradford toddler window fall murder case adjourned
text: the case of a 23-year-old woman who is due to go on trial for the murder of an 18-month-old boy has been adjourned .
gemma procter , of barkerend road in bradford , was charged after elliot procter 's fatal fall from a sixth floor window on 21 october .
her case has been adjourned while medical assessments are made to find out if she 's fit to enter a plea .
she appeared via video link at bradford crown court .

documents.title: fracking protester climbs on top of lorry
text: a protester has climbed on top of a lorry destined for the kirby misperton fracking site in north yorkshire .
the man has told police `` he plans to stay there until he is removed '' and officers have put diversions around the lorry .
drivers are being advised to avoid the a169 where the road is blocked and a contraflow has been put in place .
third energy was given planning permission to operate on the site in may 2016 .
it has not received final consent to begin fracking but expects to start before the end of the year .

documents.title: breakingbradford toddler window fall murder case : case adjourned
text: the court case of a woman who is charged with murder after an 18-month-old baby fell from a sixth floor window in bradford has been adjourned so medical tests can carried out to asses her fitness to plead .
more details to follow .

documents.title: watch : the man who turned his car into a dog
text: car customisation , it 's a big industry with some fixing massive spoilers to the back , fancy alloy wheels and suped-up engines .
but modifying your car to look like a dog ?
the owner from leeds said he did it so he did n't have to give his girlfriend lifts !

documents.title: listen : young fan 's fiver could have been used to buy ronaldo !
text: we told you earlier about a remarkable gesture from a young huddersfield town fan , adam bhana .
he found a fiver at the john smith stadium on saturday , and sent it to australian midfielder , aaron mooy , as a reward for his man-of-the-match performance against manchester united .
his dad , mo , says adam originally wanted the cash to go towards bringing real madrid 's cristiano ronaldo to the west yorkshire club :

documents.title: man seriously injured in collision with car
text: a 29-year-old-man is currently in hospital with serious injuries after being hit by a car in doncaster
he was walking with another man along the grass verge of the a614 in the hatfield area when he is said to have stepped into the road and was hit by a black peugeot 207 .
the driver of the peugeot , a 21-year-old man , and the other pedestrian , were not injured in the collision .
it happened on the a614 heading away from thorne , towards the junction with the a18 at around 00:05 yesterday morning .
police want to hear from any witnesses .

documents.title: listen : government could be asked for cash to police fracking protest
text: the government will be asked to provide additional funding for policing at ryedale 's fracking site if north yorkshire police runs out of money .
it 's cost the force almost £ 200,000 to police the protests there , up to the end of september .
police and crime commissioner , julia mulligan , says they expect the next six weeks to be the busiest .
more than 300 lorry loads of material are expected to be brought onto the kirby misperton site .
julia mulligan says they 're currently using their operational reserve , but is confident if they need government money they 'll get it :

documents.title: listen : villagers team up for faster internet connection
text: a village just outside of doncaster has finally been brought up to speed broadband speed that is .
after suffering for years at the mercy of a 2mb internet connection , a trio of residents from pembridge park in auckley , decided to take matters into their own hands .
simon fisher , craig smith and nick field worked with wireless internet service provider , quickline communications , to provide the area with an ultra-fast connection speed of up to 100mbps .
simon had quite an important motivation to find faster speeds :

documents.title: book prize nominee returns to york bookshop role
text: a york author says life 's `` almost returning to normal '' after her first book was shortlisted for the man booker prize , one of the world 's most prestigious literary awards .
fiona moseley , 29 , who works part-time at the little apple bookshop in york , started writing elmet while commuting between london and york .
she 's returned to her job at the bookshop and says now the award ceremony is over she can enjoy having been nominated :

documents.title: cctv images of armed robbery in handsworth
text: images of a masked man threatening staff with a golf club in a sheffield convenience store have been released by police to help them track down the culprit .
he fled the store with a quantity of cash and cigarettes , heading across the fields towards the back of woodhouse railway station .
the masked man entered the iron bridge convenience store on retford road , hansworth , on friday 13 october at about 09:45 .
police are also exploring the possibility that this robbery could be linked to another robbery at the same store on friday 20 october .
nobody was injured during the incident .

documents.title: jared o'mara : labour mp lucy powell calls for suspension
text: a prominent labour mp says jared o'mara should be suspended from the party while claims he made misogynistic and homophobic remarks are investigated .
former shadow education secretary lucy powell made the comments on itv after mr o'hara was accused of making offensive comments in march 2017 .
labour has launched an investigation into his behaviour .
the sheffield hallam mp apologised for remarks made online in 2002 and 2004 , but denies the more recent allegations .

documents.title: former york city player says stranger stopped him from killing himself
text: former york city footballer , clarke carlisle , has revealed a stranger persuaded him to speak to his family rather than take his own life .
the 38-year-old disappeared from home last month , which led to a missing persons appeal , before he was found safe and well in liverpool .

the ex-chairman of the professional footballers ' association said he 'd been `` strolling around '' liverpool and was `` headstrong set on the most convenient way to kill himself '' when a passing stranger intervened .
in december 2014 he tried to take his own life , when he jumped into the path of a lorry on the a64 near york .

documents.title: watch : new homes wanted for scarborough sea life centre 's penguins
text: an animal park in north yorkshire is looking for new homes for some of its penguins .
scarborough sea life centre has seen three new chicks born to its humboldt penguins colony .
the park is now looking to relocate some of the birds to other wildlife centres .

documents.title: click and collect scheme to encourage local shopping
text: shoppers in a north yorkshire town are being encouraged to buy closer to home , online .
a new website 's been launched which brings independent stores in thirsk and their products together in one place .
after people place an order , each store then and bags it ready for the customer to go to the shop and collect it .

documents.title: terriers fan sends £ 5 to goal hero mooy
text: what do you do when you find a fiver but your dad has always told you to `` not keep what is not ours '' ?
you send it to your favourite player instead .
that 's what a young huddersfield town fan did on saturday when he made the lucky discovery at the john smith 's stadium .
town fan adam sent the £ 5 note as a reward for australian midfielder aaron mooy after his man-of-the-match performance against manchester united last week .
in an accompanying letter , adam wrote that `` mooy can keep the money because he played very well and scored '' .

documents.title: check your train journey this morning
text: the trains seem to be running smoothly this morning without any significant delays .
you can click on the links below to keep up-to-date with the live departure boards for :
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: listen : rotherham woman shocked at fine for feeding the birds
text: an 83-year-old from rotherham says she 's shocked after being fined £ 80 for feeding the birds .
jean corker was accused of littering , after putting fat balls and mealworms on the ground for the pigeons in the town centre last week .
she was handed a penalty notice by an official , who said there were signs warning against the activity in the area .
but jean thinks the action is a bit heavy handed :
rotherham council have since reviewed the fine and cancelled it , saying it did n't believe this was a suitable case for the issue of a fixed penalty notice .

documents.title: 'breaking-point ' for traders as roadworks blamed for loss of trade
text: businesses in a west yorkshire town say they 're at breaking-point because of roadworks cutting them off from passing trade .
the road-widening work at salterhebble hill , between huddersfield and halifax is expected to take a year .
but just two months into the project local businesses are rallying together and calling for financial support from calderdale council .
the council says its long term aim is to help boost local businesses and that it continues to do all it can to minimise disruption .

documents.title: yorkshire 's wednesday weather
text: a mainly dry and bright day , although patchy cloud may cling to the pennines through the morning .
there 'll be some sunny spells during the day , the best of these will be in the east .
this evening it 'll stay dry with some clearer spells into the evening .
cloud will spread from the south through the early hours , with some rain possible in the west by dawn .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: fracking site protests £ 180,000 policing bill
text: policing protests at a shale gas fracking site in north yorkshire has cost the force almost £ 200,000 so far .
the police and crime commissioner ( pcc ) , julia mulligan , said the force had spent £ 80,000 up to august 31st and just over £ 100,000 in september .
so far 26 people have been arrested at the site at kirby misperton during september .
the pcc said the figures included overtime , equipment and subsistence and travel-related costs .
she said the force has the necessary contingencies and budgets in place to ensure it can deal with situations like the protests , but said it would have an impact on policing the county .
ms mulligan says if costs rise significantly she will seek assurances government funds would be forthcoming .

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: hello and welcome to bbc local live in yorkshire on wednesday 25 october 2017 .
we 'll be with you until 18:00 with all the latest news , weather , travel and sport updates from across yorkshire .
we usually start with a reflecting the beauty of yorkshire , as the weather shapes and colours its contours .
we can see the impact of the weather with today 's opening image , but rather than ornamenting the landscape it 's perplexing a pooch .
a very bad hair day indeed for crumble says bbc weather watcher , sandie .
if you snap anything you 'd like to share with the rest of yorkshire , you can send it in by simply clicking here .
author: Andrew Barton
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire
